noun.description: A greater liking for one alternative over another or others.
examples: he chose a clock in preference to a watch
a preference for long walks and tennis over jogging

noun.description: A prior right or precedence, especially in connection with the payment of debts.
examples: debts owed to the community should be accorded a preference

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense promotion): from Old French, from medieval Latin praeferentia, from Latin praeferre carry in front (see prefer).
